publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3255 Joe FitzPatrick: Sunday Post’s 90th Birthday—That the Parliament congratulates publishers DC Thomson and Co on the 90th birthday of The Sunday Post; notes that The Sunday Post was created in 1919 from The Post Sunday Special, a newspaper that was originally produced to ensure that lists of World War One casualties, which were released on a Saturday evening, could be available as soon as possible; further recognises that The Sunday Post is a Scottish institution enjoying an impressive readership of 950,000 and is home to Scottish icons The Broons and Oor Wullie; looks forward to its continued longevity and success in future years, and wishes everyone connected with The Sunday Post, both past and present, all the best.

S3M-3255 Sunday Post’s 90th Birthday (lodged on 20 January 2009) Nigel Don*, Nanette Milne*, Elizabeth Smith*, Liam McArthur*, Bashir Ahmad*, Jackson Carlaw*, Christopher Harvie*, Stuart McMillan*, Mike Pringle*, John Lamont*, Mary Scanlon*, Bill Kidd*, Bob Doris*, Alasdair Allan*, Rob Gibson*, David McLetchie*, David Whitton*, Kenneth Gibson*, Hugh O’Donnell*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Ross Finnie*, Alex Neil*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Christina McKelvie*, Jamie McGrigor*, Derek Brownlee*, Christine Grahame*, Murdo Fraser*, Keith Brown*, Ted Brocklebank*, Aileen Campbell*, Sandra White*, Margaret Smith*
S3M-3255 Sunday Post’s 90th Birthday (lodged on 20 January 2009) Robin Harper*, Brian Adam*, Gil Paterson*

S3M-3255 Joe FitzPatrick: Sunday Post’s 90th Birthday—That the Parliament congratulates publisher DC Thomson and Co on the 90th birthday of The Sunday Post; notes that The Sunday Post was created in 1919 from The Post Sunday Special, a newspaper that was originally produced to ensure that lists of World War One casualties, which were released on a Saturday evening, could be available as soon as possible; further recognises that The Sunday Post is a Scottish institution enjoying an impressive readership of 950,000 and is home to Scottish icons The Broons and Oor Wullie; looks forward to its continued longevity and success in future years, and wishes everyone connected with The Sunday Post, both past and present, all the best. Supported by: Nigel Don, Nanette Milne, Elizabeth Smith, Liam McArthur, Bashir Ahmad, Jackson Carlaw, Christopher Harvie, Stuart McMillan, Mike Pringle, John Lamont, Mary Scanlon, Bill Kidd, Bob Doris, Alasdair Allan, Rob Gibson, David McLetchie, David Whitton, Kenneth Gibson, Hugh O’Donnell, Mr Frank McAveety, Ross Finnie, Alex Neil, Roseanna Cunningham, Christina McKelvie, Jamie McGrigor, Derek Brownlee, Christine Grahame, Murdo Fraser, Keith Brown, Ted Brocklebank, Aileen Campbell, Sandra White, Margaret Smith, Robin Harper, Brian Adam, Gil Paterson, Angela Constance*
S3M-3255 Sunday Post’s 90th Birthday (lodged on 20 January 2009) Margaret Mitchell*, Hugh Henry*
S3M-3255 Sunday Post’s 90th Birthday (lodged on 20 January 2009) Johann Lamont*, John Scott*
S3M-3255 Sunday Post’s 90th Birthday (lodged on 20 January 2009) Jack McConnell*
S3M-3255 Sunday Post’s 90th Birthday (lodged on 20 January 2009) Peter Peacock*
S3M-3255 Sunday Post’s 90th Birthday (lodged on 20 January 2009) Marlyn Glen* Contents An A B C D E F G H I J
